view

Interface IIPView

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    IPView, IPViewNoGUI

    public interface IIPView
    An interface for the view of the program - a GUI interface that displays images and receives user input regarding image editing commands. Responds to user events by calling methods from the controller's Features list.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
      Adds the provided buffered image to the view's display, replacing any existing image.
      void clearScriptBox()
      Clears out any text in the script editor box.
      void display()
      Display the view.
      void displayError(java.lang.String errorMessage)
      Display the provided error message as a popup dialog box.
      java.lang.String getCheckerboardSpecs()
      Requests user input via a popup dialog box - user is expected to provide a square size value for a checkerboard generation operation.
      java.io.File getFileToOpen()
      Opens a dialog box that allows a user to select an image file for opening.
      java.io.File getFileToSaveAs()
      Opens a dialog box that allows a user to select or name an image file for opening.
      java.lang.String[] getRainbowSpecs()
      Requests user input via a popup dialog box - user is expected to provide orientation, height, and width values for a rainbow generation operation.
      java.lang.String getSeedPixelNum()
      Requests user input via a popup dialog box - user is expected to provide a seed number for a mosaic editing operation.
      void setFeatures(Features f)
      Get the set of feature callbacks that the view can call from the model.

    • Method Detail

      • display

        void display()
        Display the view. To be called after the the view is fully constructed.

      • setFeatures

        void setFeatures(Features f)
        Get the set of feature callbacks that the view can call from the model.
        Parameters:
        f - the set of feature callbacks as a Features object.

      • addImage

        void addImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        Adds the provided buffered image to the view's display, replacing any existing image.

      • getFileToOpen

        java.io.File getFileToOpen()
        Opens a dialog box that allows a user to select an image file for opening. The file must be one of the following types: "png", "jpg", "jpeg", "bmp", "wbmp", "gif". Returns a File object referencing the selected file, or null if the dialog box is closed.
        Returns:
        a file object referencing the selected file, or null if the dialog box is closed.

      • getFileToSaveAs

        java.io.File getFileToSaveAs()
        Opens a dialog box that allows a user to select or name an image file for opening. Returns a File object referencing the chosen file name, or null if the dialog box is closed. Does not check if the named file has a valid image file extension - this must be tested separately.
        Returns:
        a File object referencing the chosen file name, or null if the dialog box is closed.

      • displayError

        void displayError(java.lang.String errorMessage)
        Display the provided error message as a popup dialog box.
        Parameters:
        errorMessage - the error message to be displayed.

      • getSeedPixelNum

        java.lang.String getSeedPixelNum()
        Requests user input via a popup dialog box - user is expected to provide a seed number for a mosaic editing operation. Returns null if user exits the dialog box without entering information.
        Returns:
        the user's seed input, as a string; null if user exits the dialog box.

      • getRainbowSpecs

        java.lang.String[] getRainbowSpecs()
        Requests user input via a popup dialog box - user is expected to provide orientation, height, and width values for a rainbow generation operation. Returns null if user exits the dialog box without entering information.
        Returns:
        the user's square size input, as a string; null if user exits the dialog box.

      • getCheckerboardSpecs

        java.lang.String getCheckerboardSpecs()
        Requests user input via a popup dialog box - user is expected to provide a square size value for a checkerboard generation operation. Returns null if user exits the dialog box without entering information.
        Returns:
        the user's square size input, as a string; null if user exits the dialog box.

      • clearScriptBox

        void clearScriptBox()
        Clears out any text in the script editor box.
